author: kfogel
msg: Simplify the error declaration interface, and force developers to
specify an offset when adding a new error.  This makes it harder to
accidentally insert a new error into the middle of a range:
presumably, while renumbering the subsequent errors, one would think
to oneself "There's got to be a better way, hmmm... perhaps I'll go
read the comments in this file to see if I'm missing something."
(SVN_ERRDEF): Take an offset argument; all callers changed.

author: blair
msg: Follow up to revision 2958.  In the `svn help status' output,
document the new status key `~', which is printed when a file is
versioned but a directory exists instead with the same filename, or

author: gstein
msg: Add Daniel Berlin's draft of a 'blame' script.

author: kfogel
msg: Resolve issue #702, fragment the error code space.
Note that this change will make more sense after an upcoming commit to
APR, to expand the available space for user errors.  But it works with
the current APR too, because the first category offset leaps right
past the highest APR error anyway.  You may credit or blame Greg Stein
for that bit of cleverness, as you please :-).
(SVN_ERR_CATEGORY_FIRST): New macro, conditional expansion just as
(SVN_ERR_CATEGORY_SIZE): New constant for the category increment.
SVN_ERR_CL_CATEGORY_START): New categories, use them to start off
the first error in each catgory.
Also, reorganize errors and remove unused ones:
And finally, fallout from the removal of SVN_ERR_CANCELED:
Removed, no one uses this now.  When we make cancellation available
again, it will be done through svn_wc_notify_func_t, which will
change to non-void return so it can signal cancellations.
This is an empty revision for padding.
